item.description:
In a permaculture system, fall is an excellent time to build your no-dig garden beds for next year's planting. Join us at The Long Branch School for an in-depth, one-day crash course to learn this technique which could revolutionize the way you garden...

In this course you will:

  • Learn about the best and easiest ways to create living, fertile soils.
  • Build garden beds any size or shape using materials from your home or neighborhood.
  • Control weeds and minimize the need for irrigation.
  • Become ready to stop digging and tilling or create gardens where digging and tilling are not possible.
  • Turn lawn or weedy areas into productive gardens.
  • Learn to build soil the way nature intended, just faster!

This course includes a classroom segment with images and handouts followed by a hands-on exercise in creating gardens using the no-dig method.

Instructor:  Lisa Fernandes

What to bring: Notebook & Pen, Work Shoes,Work Gloves, Clothes to get dirty (layered for weather).  We'll contact class participants in advance regarding lunch plans for the day.

Important!  This course is offered by The Longbranch School in downtown Bowdoinham (approximately 45 minutes by car north of Portland).  You can RSVP here and use the comments area to organize carpools etc.  But you must register with payment via The Longbranch School directly to hold your spot!
